required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: DNA Analysis of Tissue Samples From Patients With Head and Neck Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Genetic Analysis of Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock:
RATIONALE: Studying samples of tissue from patients with cancer in the laboratory may help doctors learn more about changes that occur in DNA and identify biomarkers related to cancer.
PURPOSE: This laboratory study is looking at DNA in tissue samples from patients with head and neck cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
OBJECTIVES:
- Assess common genetic mutations in tumor and germline DNA samples from patients with head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC).
- Search for viral DNAs and relate this information to demographics, tumor characteristics, and patient prognosis.
- Search for novel viral sequences and cancer-associated gene mutations in young nonsmoking HNSCC patients and in other distinct head and neck cancers.
- Determine tumor suppressor gene mutations in HNSCC patients and relate this information to gene expression data.
- Validate gene expression information using independent techniques such as real-time PCR on expressed sequences and immunohistochemistry.
OUTLINE: Genetic mutation analysis and gene expression studies are performed on tissue samples from patients with head and neck squamous cell carcinoma. Techniques used include real time-PCR and immunohistochemistry.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess common genetic mutations in tumor and germline DNA samples
primary_outcome.time_frame: Upon collection of final patient data

primary_outcome.measure: Viral DNAs related to demographics, tumor characteristics, and patient prognosis
primary_outcome.time_frame: Upon collection of final patient data

primary_outcome.measure: Novel viral sequences and cancer-associated gene mutations in young nonsmoking patients with head and neck squamous cell carcinoma and in other distinct head and neck cancers
primary_outcome.time_frame: Upon collection of final patient data

primary_outcome.measure: Tumor suppressor gene mutations related to gene expression data
primary_outcome.time_frame: upon collection of final patient data

primary_outcome.measure: Validation of gene expression information using independent techniques such as real-time PCR on expressed sequences and immunohistochemistry
primary_outcome.time_frame: upon collection of final patient data

biospec_descr.textblock: Assess common genetic mutations in tumor and germline DNAs from HNSCCs and search for viral DNAs and relate this information to demographics, tumor characteristics and patient prognosis.

study_pop.textblock: Nonsmoking patients less than 40 years of age at first diagnosis of HNSCC.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) enrolled in the Head and Neck Tissue Repository
- Sufficient biological material collected to perform study tests
- Historical material available from excess tissues at the Vanderbilt Pathology Department
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not specified
PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY:
- Not specified
